definition: to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on
to look up at/to look up to sb hopefully
to admire/to revere/to look up to
to tilt one's head back to see (sth)/to look up at
Yangon (Rangoon), city, capital of Myanmar from 1948 to 2006
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth

sentences.english: Will it greeting be courteous or rough?
sentences.chinese: 它的问候是谦恭仰或粗鲁？

sentences.english: Inhale, slide the hips forwards, and arch the head and chest up into the Cobra pose (see pp. 64-5).
sentences.chinese: 吸气，臀部往前推，头向前仰并扩胸，成眼镜蛇式。

sentences.english: I fear, or I find Yang.
Lie on your back and grasp a dumbbell or cable handles in each hand.
sentences.chinese: 仰躺下，双手各抓一个哑铃或者拉缆。

sentences.english: The vault and invert of Liuyanghe tunnel lining are the dangerous position for the lining.
sentences.chinese: 浏阳河隧道二衬最不利位置一般位于仰拱或拱顶处。

sentences.english: The only sound that echoed in its dark dome was that of incantations which I chanted.
sentences.chinese: 在沉黑的仰顶上，独一的声音是我礼赞的反响。

sentences.english: But tailor's bird then the bounty of admire great universe.
sentences.chinese: 而裁缝鸟则是仰大自然的恩泽。

sentences.english: She felt drops of rain on her, upturned 'face.
sentences.chinese: 她感到有雨点落在她仰着的脸上。

sentences.english: Remaining in your easy Shavasana, turn your attention to the face.
sentences.chinese: 保持轻松的仰尸式，将注意力专注于脸部。

sentences.english: To vitalize education depends on schools; to mould talents depends on excellent teachers.
sentences.chinese: 教育振兴期学校，人才陶冶仰良师。

sentences.english: He awakened many times to feel it falling on his upturned face.
sentences.chinese: 他醒了好几次，感觉到雨落在他仰着的脸上。

sentences.english: Tilt your head back and let the meat slide down your throat-hole.
sentences.chinese: 把头向后仰仰，让肉从你的喉部滑下去。

sentences.english: Lying on your back with both arms up around the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 面朝天花板仰躺，双手上翻靠枕。

definition: to face upwards/to look up to the sky
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
to exhale/to blow off steam/(phonetics) aspirated
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
